Text: Re More unmetered gas lossForwarded by Becky PitreHOUECT on PM Troy Klussmann AM To Steve HPL CT cc Karry CT Becky CT Carol CT Alexia O CT Jim CT Subject Re More unmetered gas loss Steve Two questions Does the answer below suffice for our needs and If yes and with Pats answer in mind would this be a cost that would go to your group first then to Ed as OM or would it go directly to Ed I am not sure who has the ability to control these cost more directly you or Ed Thanks Troy Forwarded by Troy KlussmannHOUECT on AM Pat NRON AM To Becky CT cc Steve HPL CT Troy CT Subject Re More unmetered gas loss Becky In reviewing the spread the minimal volumes being reported are associated with the gas that supplies instrumentation on the pipeline ie pressure and flow controllers actuators valve positioners gas quality sampling and monitoring equipment etc Becky CT AM To Pat NRON cc Subject More unmetered gas loss Pat Troy Klussman was wanting to know when you would have something on the gas loss request below Thanks Becky Forwarded by Becky PitreHOUECT on AM Becky Pitre AM To Pat NRON cc Subject More unmetered gas loss Pat Attached is a file for unmetered gas loss for February You have already answered my questions regarding meters and After meeting with Steve Schneider it was decided to take a closer look at gas loss Steve would like explanations for all gas loss in Feb The attached file should help you All volumes in blue need an explanation Let me know if there is anything you need from me or if there is anything I can do Thank you Becky

Re System Unmetered GasForwarded by Becky PitreHOUECT on AM Enron North America Corp From Patricia Kirkwood ENRON AM To Becky CT cc Subject Re System Unmetered Gas Forwarded by Patricia KirkwoodGPGFINEnron on AM Tommy Hicks AM To Patricia NRON cc Subject Re System Unmetered Gas Use the unmetered number for Edna thanks thicks Forwarded by Tommy HicksGCOEnron on AM From Patricia Kirkwood AM To Pat NRON Tom NRON Tommy NRON Sam NRON cc Gary NRON Cheryl NRON Esther NRON Peggy NRON Clara NRON Subject Re System Unmetered Gas Which unmetered station is to be used or Tommy Hicks AM To Cheryl NRON Esther NRON Patricia NRON Gary NRON cc Pat NRON Tom NRON Subject System Unmetered Gas On a pipeline leak was found on system By the evidence found it is believed to have been present for several months We need to go back to at least January for corrections Please input this gas loss to the system balance The estimated gas loss for January through April is as follows January MCF DTH February MCF DTH March MCF DTH April MCF DTH Gas loss for May will be forwarded as soon as we obtain the pressure readings from meter Attached is the supporting documentation used to calculate these volumes If you have any questions please call thanks thicks

Re More unmetered gas lossForwarded by Becky PitreHOUECT on PM Troy Klussmann AM To Steve HPL CT cc Karry CT Becky CT Carol CT Alexia O CT Jim CT Subject Re More unmetered gas loss Steve Two questions Does the answer below suffice for our needs and If yes and with Pats answer in mind would this be a cost that would go to your group first then to Ed as OM or would it go directly to Ed I am not sure who has the ability to control these cost more directly you or Ed Thanks Troy Forwarded by Troy KlussmannHOUECT on AM Pat NRON AM To Becky CT cc Steve HPL CT Troy CT Subject Re More unmetered gas loss Becky In reviewing the spread the minimal volumes being reported are associated with the gas that supplies instrumentation on the pipeline ie pressure and flow controllers actuators valve positioners gas quality sampling and monitoring equipment etc Becky CT AM To Pat NRON cc Subject More unmetered gas loss Pat Troy Klussman was wanting to know when you would have something on the gas loss request below Thanks Becky Forwarded by Becky PitreHOUECT on AM Becky Pitre AM To Pat NRON cc Subject More unmetered gas loss Pat Attached is a file for unmetered gas loss for February You have already answered my questions regarding meters and After meeting with Steve Schneider it was decided to take a closer look at gas loss Steve would like explanations for all gas loss in Feb The attached file should help you All volumes in blue need an explanation Let me know if there is anything you need from me or if there is anything I can do Thank you Becky
